page.title: 03 CHAIR AND STOOL FACTORY
page.content: Fred Hunt began his factory in Stokenchurch in 1927.It has always been family run and is now managed by Tom North & his two sons.There are 16 employees.23 styles of chair include traditional{wheelback and Windsor. Seats are imported hardwood & English elm.{Beech}for legs etc.is,sadly, European & no longer locally grown,but it is turned by a local firm.The wood is kiln-dried.The seats go to the mill to be sawn,drilled & shaped by machine;then to the sanding,assembly & polishing shops.After being levelled they are despatched by road to kitchen centres & bar fitters all over the country.In{Nov.1984}there was a serious fire & lacquer in the polishing shop exploded. In a typical week,{200}wheelbacks, {150}bar stools &{36}armchairs are made.
